comment:
The smoothest whiskey you will ever have.  Also the most flavorless whiskey you will ever have.

I will pass next time at any price.  

***edit - I ended up dumping some of this in my Infiniti bottle and the rest down the drain*** tasteless!!

Barrel 28 -18  The very first thing you will note about this Sazerac offering is the exact, and I mean EXACT replication of the Blantons bottling process.  From the little pewter Caribou mounted on a flat, hammered cork head, to the bottle bag and box, it is clearly a direct rip off of the Blantons packaging.  Wither you find this an off putting encroachment, or an affectionate emulation of style, there is no denying the "stolen" characteristic of the display choice, not that the BT-Saz owned entities would care or have a say in the matter.  At least the bottles are square-ish, with pleasing round corners rather than the 8 sided "crystal ball" style bottles we are used to with the top notch bourbon.  The license style hologram stickers are a nice touch as well that carries over to the neck band.  Ok bottling asthetics aside, as we know, it's really whats inside that counts. 
                  
                  On the nose this is a spicy dram, a reminder of some other northern border offerings come to mind.  Not much beyond some bold rye spice to be found though. 
                  
                  The liquid defers an oily residue on the insides of my mini goblet and seems to retain a coating on the sides. 
                  With all respect to Derek, that reported "burst" of flavor seems to me nothing more than the spice we detected earlier.  These differences could be explained from the single barrel nature of this offering.  Letting the whiskey breath and open a bit with a few drops of water makes only a small difference as the rye spice continues to stand out.  Certianly some small variants of sweetness in caramels and dank sugars but these are mostly over powered on the palate by the afore mentioned spice of most certianly rye origin.   For a single barrel Canadian product this is not entirely unpredicted, nor is it unpleasent, however the barrel finish never really seems to materialize.  Perhaps judged verse the strict whiskey classes this would stand up but as a  bourbon aficionado there is less here in the wood finish and complexity in flavors to take  away.  
                  
                  The finish is perhaps warmer than an 80 proofer would typically yield and the lingering spices carry forward.   All and all not a bad effort, an enjoyable high rye drink that imparts little else but has nothing to complain about either.   A very decent drink but just not a dram that goes on the "must try" list. 
                  
                  Perhaps the undoing of the Caribou will be the massive expectations some will derive from the packaging that shouts "Blantons" but whose contents are less than the very top notch product that is implied. This may be a satisfying drink but under no circumstances would you trade a bottle of Blantons for it.
What a cool bottle! The inside is very smooth and pleasant. Distinctive chocolate and caramel notes. A little bit like bourbon but all in all - mid class. (177pln wf'18)

I usually find Canadian whisky a little on the sweet side for my taste. Thought I would try this since most reviews rated it pretty high and I would get a cool bottle topper in the process. I was happily surprised when I took a sip of this! Definitely more wood on the nose and palette than most Canadian varieties, especially on the back end. with caramel and just a hint of maple that really smooths this one out.
Very light, smooth, and enjoyable. This is delicate but an excellent example of a delicate whiskey.  Don't discount it.
Very smooth very aromatic on the nose. Very good for the price point.
3-21-17.   3.9.  Very good.   Smooth but great body

A bit of mustiness initially hits you on the nose, with hints of honey and walnuts following. Surprising. Unfortunately, the nose is the best thing about this whiskey. Very smooth on the tongue, muted, almost tasteless at first. Then... nothing. A burst of flavor never comes. Slight bitterness develops after a while. The finish is short and dry, the warmth (or lack of) is not surprising for a minimum proof whiskey. Will try it again later, maybe it'll open up with time. 3/22/17
Fourth time trying this, it's improved ever so slightly, but still not something I'll reach for. Given the good reviews I've seen elsewhere, I'll chalk this up to a bad barrel, and just my own personal palate idiosynchracies. 4/20/17
Great whisky get it if you find it
Initially strong on the nose with a smooth, honey finish. Smooth smoke finish
Cotton candy sweet, smooth, but like most Canadian whiskey... a bit thin.
Très impressionné comme produit, je m'attendais à un brand super marketing et un produit bas de game pour le prix.....PAS DU TOUT. C'est vraiment awesome et tout en douceur. Un luxe en camping! Haha

A solid starter whisky. This whisky can hold its own vs most. Definitely above a mixer grade. Taste is relatively smooth, slightly fruity finish with a clean aftertaste. The bottle and presentation is the nicer end but at a price point that makes me question it's overall value.  Not on top of my favorite choice around the $50 price point. I give it 86 points out of 100.
Maple syrup and vanilla on the nose. Vanilla and heaven on the palate. Super smooth and an obvious go-to whiskey that will convert non-whiskey lovers to new whiskey lovers! 8/10
Classic Canadian Whiskey that is sweeter and very smooth. Good one for making Old Fashion’s.
Huge cinnamon aroma.  Less so on the taste, where there was something offsetting the sweet - maybe leather.
Light and tasty. Great summer whiskey
Smooth tasting With a light barrell finish.
Not bad. Simple but nice taste. A bit hot for lower proof.

A little soft for my tastes at 80 proof but a nice sipper to have around as a first pour or for whiskey newbies.

Nice classic BT caramel flavor - as far as low proofers go it simply blows Basil Hayden away.
Love the caramel,leather and chocolate notes. This a very tasty sipper. This is one o would have on the shelf for when friends come over.
Smooth. Full of flavor. Light on the finish. Bourbon is my norm , but this is one Canadian Whiskey I would go back to.

vanilla nose, not much else.
slightly sweet, some rye spice.
very smooth and easy to drink. no aftertaste

Nose: initially could smell a lot of oaky flavors with some Smokey flavors thrown in. Let it sit for about 10 minutes and came to smell some dark fruits like plum and dark cherry. 

Taste: tastes totally different then what I was expecting from the smell. I tasted hints of chocolate with a lot of sweet fruits like orange and even maraschino cherries. 

A little hesitant to buy it, because I didn’t know much about Canadian whisky. However I really enjoyed it. Easy to sip, with a lot of unique flavors.
Light whiskey with a short, smooth finish. A little almond flavor.
a little sweet, hints of wheat, not enough punch for me
Caramel, toffee, vanilla, oranges. Amazing whisky.
Very smooth up front, pleasant neutral smell. Mild burn on end at room temp. All spice and vanilla.

Neat, what better way to watch ssn 8 of GOT than with some SB canadian whiskey. #Winter is coming ❄️🐉🧟‍♂️

"0-1: Beyond bad. Complete waste of money according to my tastebuds. 
2: Bad. Simply not my taste
2.5: Sub-par. Ill drink it... but only because its whiskey.
3: Good. Decent stuff, but not a rebuy
3.5: Very good. I might buy again
4: Excellent: Will be purchasing a bottle asap
4.5: Incredible: top of the purchase list
5:Amazing: cost and taste are worth every cent"
Super smooth, notes of vanilla and orange peal
Good nose with nice subtle flavors. Somewhat thin mouth feel due to the low proof with a quick finish. Would be a good daily drinker if not for the price point.
Poured this earlier as I thought it perfect to go with the @Zslug fantasy hockey league draft.

A generous sample courtesy of bourbonjosh24.  

Nose: A little unpleasant.  Acetone, vague grain notes, yeasty background notes, lemon peel, light sugars, light vanilla, just a little bit of oak.  Not particularly complex or interesting up front.  As I get more in to it I get just a hint of peach or apricot.

Flavor: Sweet, vanilla, oak, and not much else.

Finish: Pretty short with a little bit of wood.  Just a little drying with some spice.

Well...it's not bad.  Kind of bland but a background acetone note the whole way through was a little off putting.  Just not much substance.
Smooth easy drinker, shorter not to bold finish
One of the best for me, at a cheap price.
Smooth, creamy, vanilla notes.  Just damn good straight

A bit on the salty side, yet doesn't smell anything like the first taste. Smells a bit more on the salty sweet side with the pit of peaches. The pit, not the fruit. Beautiful color. Dense and dark on that golden brown. Shirt back-end flavors.

Liquid dessert. Lower proof makes it a great offering for a Bourbon amateur or my wife's friends. This is a knockout for someone who tends to err on the side of sweeter cocktails.

Caramel & chocolate dominate for me, wiyh a quick smooth finish that doesn't last at all. If I could stomach the sweetness, I could drink this all day long.
Not worth the price at all. Nice bottle but way to watered down.
Watching “Goalie”, the movie about Terry Sawchuk. Thought this was obligatory. @Zslug
Incredibly smooth, although could have a bit more of a bite. Incredibly well-rounded and lasts longer on the palate then expected considering the smoothness. Highly recommend.
Virtual happy hour with @Zslug Lyndsay @Kyle-Metes-Randolph Henry and Matt!

Was so excited to try this after a guy who worked at Sazerac told me I had to try it and also when I bought it at the store the guy there said I was going to love it...so I get it home and wah wah wah it's lousy, nothing whatsoever stands out, it could literally be any plain old booze, dry and bland, a friend tried it too and without mr giving my option said the same thing, at least it has a cool metal Caribou on top 😊

Maïs doux et crémeux. Douces épices de seigle pointant le nez derrière le caramel au beurre, la vanille et les pruneaux cuits, comme le ferait la noix de muscade sur du riz au lait. La vigueur rafraichissante des agrumes est giflée d’épices poivrées brûlantes.
Delicious! Nose is strong butterscotch and vanilla. Light mouthfeel with a strong butterscotch finish.

N: Very faint if any... honey?
P: Light and oily like an Irish whiskey. Very light honey pear front.
F: Lingering char with some of that fruity taste hanging around.

Ok let's be honest. I bought this for the cool caribou topper!

Nose is heavy on the alchohol side. Almost offputting to be honest. 

Taste is better than expected given the nose. Flavor is very subtle and smooth. Malty cinnamon with a hint of candied nuts. Overall a decent sip, but not something I would scour the stores to find.
Sweet on the lips and draw, a little bit of spice and bite on the swallow. Lots of charecter.
Smooth introduction to bourbon for newbies, and a good pour if you don't want the heat.  4 stars for fitting the profile.

Neat. Gallenstein #1. Neck pour.  Very similar to Blanton’s on the nose.  Vanilla, charred caramel, baking spices, honey graham cracker.

Thicker than expected for being 80 proof.  It’s rock candy sugar on the tongue.  Vanilla frosting with a slight hint of the charred caramel.  That honey graham cracker comes through more on subsequent sips.  Odd after taste though.  There is this musty note that lingers very slightly on the legs that throws me off.

All in all, this is what I expected.  It’s a solid, light sweet treat.  A good intro whiskey.  Hard to say it was worth the $50 beyond the novelty of the beautiful stopper.

Neat.  Opened a few months.  Gallenstein pick. A bit different than I remember.  Getting more on the nose than I recall last time.  Light cedar and vanilla.  Little apple.  Hint of graham cracker.  Hint of cinnamon.

It’s light but also oily, gives it an unexpected thickness.  Vanilla reigns supreme.  Hint of mint and maybe apple but it’s just a creamy vanilla through and through.  Bit dry on the finish with a hint of that cedar.  On subsequent sips that mint becomes more dominant.

I like this more than the last time I tried it.  This is a beginners whiskey.  Give this to a newbie, let them get used to the low proof and see if they can pick out the vanilla.  I’ll never buy this again but I must admit that it got better beyond the neck pour.  If I did buy it again, it would be as a gift to a novice whiskey drinker.

Very nice Canadian whiskey that has a much more complex flavor profile than crown Royale limited and reserve. Very smooth at the front and middle, with a slight subtle bite near the end. Notes and hints of caramel and sweet as expected, but also hints of spice and a very pleasant aftertaste that isn't too strong

Really smooth with lots of vanilla and carmel flavor notes. Sweet = yes. Little burn, as expected at just 80 proof. Finish is fairly quick. Great choice for someone new to bourbon because it is so enjoyable but not complex. First experience was a pleasant one.

The only thing I don’t like about this is the lack of the ABV! Because of that though, it is ultra smooth and it’s  like drinking butter. I think the flavor is there and is a welcome change when I want something different every now and then. Best Canadian I’ve had hands down!!
